The Gribblingsnare

Beware the Gribblingsnare, beware!

Prat-tapping toes on speckled sand.
The brizzling strings he'd understand,
Then seek the Gribblingsnare's dark lair.

He left the Music Room with cheer,

"O frabjous day! I've naught to fear!"
The blarp-strains filled the vibrant air.

Beware the Music Room's snorgling sound,
Where gleepers frazz and flumphs abound;

The Layguff at Layover Bay

Bemind the jabbling, zeeber waves,
Where florpish moonpools gleep and gleam.
Bewarn the Layguff what behavs
In swackled jungles, shreek a-stream.

His pample claws go snick-snick-snack!
The fribbous foliage shakes with fear.
With fankle-pack upon thy back,
Take up thy glemsword, volunteer!

He frangles with a whirr-zoom-zing!
The Slorgum beast with eyes aflame.
One proddle-lunge, one glimmer-swing!
Then zazzle-bang! and quiets came.

And as the twink-twonk tiderolls play,
The Layguff’s gone, the quest is done.
With jollybells, they flim and bray
Beneath the glad and glinting sun.

Bemind the jabbling, zeeber waves,

The Snapsnoot

Beware the Snapsnoot, lensy foe!
The whirr-whirr whiff of filmic woe.

Avoid its blink and sudden beam!

Prepare your reely silver-strand,

Then zzzip! It comes with clacky whirr,

He homeward treads with pleased returns.
The village greets with glad hooray,
The Snapsnoot's light is put away.

Beware the Snapsnoot, lensy foe!
